categories.title: ElizaOS Community Updates and Developments - February 9, 2026

content.text: ElizaOS released their second weekly roundup video titled 'Cron Job S1E2' covering major developments including PageIndex achieving 98.7% RAG accuracy, the Milaidy personal AI assistant launch, Babylon's internal testing phase, token migration deadline issues, Claude Opus 4.6 integration, ElizaCloud bug fixes, and Ethereum officially welcoming ElizaOS cross-chain functionality. The team continues active development work despite market conditions.

Shaw appeared on the Green Pill podcast to discuss ElizaOS, covering topics including agent-native games, open source culture, abundance networks, and why software is getting cheaper while agency, ownership, and coordination matter more. A LinkedIn post highlighted security setup guides for Openclaw/Moltbot/Clawdbot aimed at non-technical users, demonstrating community efforts to make the technology more accessible.

Technical discussions in the developer channels focused on wallet management plugins for Openclaw, with developers working on game integrations. Users reported errors on fresh Milaidy installations including issues with the agent_skill_instructions provider and plugin registry service authorization failures. The team acknowledged some errors as normal and others requiring fixes. Questions arose about Cardano wallet integration possibilities for ElizaOS.

Community sentiment showed significant frustration over token price decline and perceived lack of communication from the team. Multiple users expressed concerns about continuous price drops, with the token down significantly from highs. Confusion emerged around Korean exchange listings, with claims of delisting from Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit, though some community members disputed these claims. Users debated whether the old AI16Z token or new ElizaOS token was affected. Token holders called for more transparency and concrete plans from the team regarding token utility and use cases.

A community video analysis highlighted ElizaOS developments including Babylon (described as 'The City of AI Agents'), Hyperscape (the first MMO built for agents), and positioning for the next wave of AI agent adoption. The video covered why AI agents are now playing games and ElizaOS's strategic direction. Some community members emphasized the project's strong tokenomics with over 85% supply in circulation and encouraged patience during market downturns.
